results.title: The Girl from Tomorrow. Ep 10-12
results.creator_credit: Kathy Mueller, Noel Price, Nine Network and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Alana, the girl from the year 3000, with the help of Irene, Jenny’s mother, and James, the good-looking science teacher from Jenny’s school, battle the charming but ruthless Silverthorn for control of the time capsule in a series of dramatic adventures which lead to a spectacular climax. Share in the excitement, mystery and adventure of a girl a thousand years from home - the girl from tomorrow.

results.title: The Girl from Tomorrow. Ep 1-3
results.creator_credit: Kathy Mueller, Noel Price, Nine Network and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Alana, a lively 13 year old from the year 3000, finds herself stranded in a strange and primitive world when a time-travel experiment goes terribly wrong. She is kidnapped by Silverthorn, a fugitive war-lord from the dangerous and violent times of the year 2500 and they crash land in a rubbish dump in Sydney in the year 1990. Alana crawls from the battered time capsule, leaving Silverthorn unconscious, and escapes with her personal wrist computer P.J. as her only companion. Cold, hungry and frightened, she is discovered by Jenny, a rebellious purple-haired girl her own age and Petey, Jenny’s science fiction obsessed younger brother.

results.title: The Girl can't help it
results.creator_credit: Frank Tashlin and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: This wonderfully farcical comedy is the first big budget rock and roll movie of the fifties and features seventeen great songs of the era. Tom Ewell plays a down and out agent who is hired by a mobster to make a star out of his sex-pot girlfriend (Jayne Mansfield). Ewell gives her a rock and roll act in the hope of making the big time but Jayne yearns for the simple life and complications set in when she falls for Ewell, while searching for the perfect husband. Includes Little Richard, Eddie Cochran, Gene Vincent, Platters, Fats Domino and more. Also stars Edmond O’Brien.

results.title: The Girl and her trust
results.brief_description: An attempted train robbery by some tramps goes awry when a young telephonist alerts the next station. Features a great train chase. Cast includes Dorothy Bernard, Wilfred Lucas, Edwin August, Charles Gorman, Walter Long. Silent film with English intertitles.

results.title: The Gin game [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Terry Hughes, Nederlander Film and RKO Radio Pictures
results.brief_description: A brilliantly acted comedy drama about a developing relationship between two very different individuals who reside in a nursing home - Weller (Hume Cronyn), a long time resident with a gruff and impatient exterior who has alienated most of the other elderly residents and timid newcomer, a diabetic, Fonsia (Jessica Tandy). Set on the sun porch of the nursing home, the two strike up a somewhat painful relationship over several games of gin rummy where each reminisces about their past, dredging up memories and emotions perhaps best left alone. Funny, sad, confronting, entertaining - it is a pleasure to watch two such great actors performing on stage. Originally produced for the Broadway stage and directed by Mike Nichols, D.L. Coburn’s Pulitzer Prize-winning play was a critical success travelling abroad to London and Russia and receiving the Tony and Drama Desk Awards for Jessica Tandy and the L.A. Drama Critics Circle Award for both Jessica Tandy and Hume Cronyn. This taped version for television was performed before a live audience in London in October 1979.

results.title: The Gillies report
results.creator_credit: Ted Robinson, M I G Productions, Almost Managing Company and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: Like a time capsule, this selection of highlights from the ABC television series “The Gillies report” captures some of the most memorable Australian political events, situations and politicians in a way you could never imagine. Features the brilliance and wit of Max Gillies along with some of Australia’s most highly talented writers and comedians including John Clarke, Wendy Harmer, Geoff Kelso, Richard Carleton, Tracy Harvey, Don Watson.

results.title: The Gilded age
results.creator_credit: David Willcock, Time Inc and BBC
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “American visions”.
America after 1865 was dominated by two vast images in addition to that of nature. One was the Civil War. The other was the machine. Both were deeply linked. The Civil War had torn America apart. No longer could Americans believe that their country was the New Jerusalem. The vivid pictures of Mathew Brady bore testament to this painful death of innocence. The assassination of Lincoln embodied a terrifying loss and, in mourning, America invented nostalgia. The late Hudson River School, the still-lifes of John F. Peto, and the work of Winslow Homer reflect this elegiac note. On the other hand, the mechanical forces which had created the first modern war were being put to work by the northern victors. People sincerely believed in progress through science. The works of man, they now felt, could rival God’s creation. The canvasses of Thomas Eakins, America’s greatest realist painter, are imbued with this faith, but the icon of the ‘technological sublime’ is the Brooklyn Bridge. It summed up the thrusting confidence of post-Civil War America and the advent of the vertical city. For the most part, American artists still looked to Europe. The new industries of steel, the railroads and shipping had created unbelievable wealth for a small plutocracy in the North. This was the Gilded Age described by Mark Twain and Edith Wharton. Written and presented by Robert Hughes.

results.title: The Gifted ones. - Rev. ed.
results.creator_credit: Don Haldane, David Bairstow and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The gifted child, whose advanced mind distinguishes him from others of his age, is a valuable asset to society. Some say gifted children should be taught in a class of their own. Others say that the average classroom is better for them. The film presents the views of two prominent educators: Dr Florence Dunlop, Ottawa, and Dr. T.W. Martin, Toronto.

results.title: The Gifted child (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Can you multiply 65x65 in your head? Do you know what chromosomes are? A seven year old child answers both these questions in a few seconds at the beginning of this film. This film investigates new research into the ways children think and use their imagination, and also new techniques of education.
